bug.author: htmbennis
bug.summary: tfjs-models/coco-ssd Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read property 'read' of undefined with script tag example

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/htmbennis>@htmbennis</denchmark-link> this will be fixed in upcoming 2.2 release
I'm having this problem too. Is there any workaround or version that works?
You can lock the TFJS version to 2.0.1

Hi - same problem, tried locking to 2.0.1 but getting an error - Uncaught (in promise) Error: The dtype of dict['image_tensor'] provided in model.execute(dict) must be int32, but was float32. I'm using video, it won't let me cast it. Any tips to get round this? I'm a newbie so any advice is greatly appreciated. I'm using both TF object and 3d face landmark model together. No issues until this week when @2.0.3 objects stopped working and giving the error uncaught - read etc.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Laurenceldp>@Laurenceldp</denchmark-link> you can checkout <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kalmufti/tfjs-webcam/tree/master>my github repo</denchmark-link> for reference, it also has a Glitch app. feel free to test it and/or remix it at <denchmark-link:https://tfjswebcam.glitch.me>https://tfjswebcam.glitch.me</denchmark-link> .
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kalmufti>@kalmufti</denchmark-link> Thanks so much for this, really helpful!

@kalmufti Thanks so much for this, really helpful!
Glad it helped you :) I would really appreciate it if you give my repo a star ‚≠ê I intend to keep it up to date, also add more models like PosNet, etc.

As a temp solution, you can use older versions of tfjs This are the scripts that made it work for me <denchmark-code><script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@tensorflow/tfjs@1.7.4/dist/tf.min.js"></script> <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@tensorflow-models/coco-ssd@2.1.0/dist/coco-ssd.min.js"></script> </denchmark-code>
Not just the script, facing the same with the npm module too.. Temporarily TFJS 2.0.0 worked fine.
